full_summary:
### Landscaping and Grounds Maintenance Services for the Embassy of Canada to the Netherlands

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development invites interested companies to submit a proposal for the provision of commercial landscaping and grounds maintenance services for two properties in the Netherlands: the Official Residence and the Chancery. The contract is expected to commence on January 1, 2025 and end on December 31, 2026.

**Scope of Work:**
The services required include:
- Landscaping and grounds maintenance services for the Official Residence (approximately 88,000 square meters) and the Chancery (approximately 260 square meters)
- Support for the certification of the Chancery under the TRUE zero waste certification and subsequent recertifications
- Compliance with industry standards and best practices to maintain the appearance and health of the grounds and the representational image of Canada in the Netherlands

**Important Details:**
- The Embassy of Canada to the Netherlands was designated as a heritage property and is required to maintain its properties according to industry standards and best practices.
- The contract is open to qualified bidders from around the world, and interested companies are invited to submit a proposal for the provision of the required services.

**Submission Instructions:**
- Interested companies must submit a proposal by November 29, 2024, at 14:00 PM Eastern Time
- Proposals must be submitted in the format specified by the contract documents
- The contract will be awarded to the company with the highest combined rating for technical merit and price.

**Attachment:**
A copy of the tender notice and contract documents can be found [here][1].

**Contact Information:**
For more information, please contact Claude Raymond at internationalproposals@international.gc.ca.

[1]: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/50215/24-263536---hague---rfp_2.pdf
